turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about A Bride of the Plains.
turn.1: What was A Bride of the Plains?
turn.2: A Bride of the Plains A Bride of the Plains is a historical novel written in 1915 by Baroness Orczy, the author of the famous "The Scarlet Pimpernel" series.
turn.4: It is dedicated to the memory of Lajos Kossuth, and in the dedication the author cries out to the dead Hungarian patriot and asks him: "What would YOU have said now had vou lived to see your country tied to Austria’s chariot-wheels, the catspaw and tool of the Teutonic race which you abhorred?" The story is set in Hungary and the scene is laid in a village close to the Maros.
turn.5: What did you find interesting about it?
turn.6: The sharp, cracked sound of the Elevation bell breaks the silence of the summer morning.
turn.8: The good Pater Bonifacius is saying Mass: he, at any rate, is astir and busy with his day’s work and obligations.
turn.9: Is there anything else that happens in the book?
turn.10: Surely it is strange that at so late an hour in mid-September, with the maize waiting to be gathered in, the population of Marosfalva should be still absent from the fields!
